text: Bill Kopp (born April 17, 1962 in Rockford, Illinois) is an American animator and voice actor. He performed the "Whammy" on the 1980s game show Press Your Luck and the title character on Nelvana's Eek! The Cat. He was an animator for The Simpsons' shorts on the Tracey Ullman Show, but left after the first season. He created The Schnookums and Meat Funny Cartoon Show and Mad Jack the Pirate. He studied animation at the California Institute of the Arts. ==Other websites== * Category:American animators Category:American voice actors Category:1962 births Category:Living people Category:Actors from Rockford, Illinois
title: Bill Kopp
